BudgetObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

BudgetObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

BudgetObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

validation.validation: We only support company hierarchies for the financial plan type. Replace all company hierarchies with companies on your plan lines.

Budget_Lines_High_Volume_Data.description: 4 Digit numeric field that contains Fiscal Year Number (ie: 2008, 2009, etc).  The combination of the Fiscal Year Number and the Fiscal Schedule determine the Fiscal Year for a company.  Note that Fiscal Year Reference is not used for Budget since for Budget, the Company's configured Fiscal Schedule is used in all cases to determine the Fiscal Year.

Budget_Lines_High_Volume_Data.description: Reference to an existing Fiscal Posting Interval, Fiscal Summary Interval, Award Posting Interval. The Fiscal Summary Interval is used for the Award Summary Interval.  If the Budget is being entered by Fiscal Summary Schedules, provide the first the Summary Interval, otherwise provide the Posting Interval.

Budget_Lines_High_Volume_Data.description: Reference to existing worktags. Worktags are a way to mark tasks and business objects to make them easier to access and summarize.  Each transaction can include one value for each worktag type and is subject to configurable validation when submitted for approval.

validation.validation: A value for Organizing Dimension([Organization Dimension Type]) is required where the Budget is configured for an organizing dimension type.
The Bank Account Worktag provided is not valid for this Company.
Intercompany Affiliate Worktag is invalid for this Company

The plan lines you entered for plan [plan] contain worktags that aren't valid for this plan structure: [plan structure]. Change these worktags on the plan lines or include them on the plan structure: [worktags].
These worktag types are required for plan structure [plan structure]: [worktag types]. Add the missing worktags to this plan: [plan].
These worktag types are not enabled for budgets: [worktag types]. Enable these worktag types or remove the worktags on this plan: [plan].
[Worktag is invalid]

Budget_High_Volume_Data.description: Budget Entry and Budget Entry Line data

validation.validation: Cannot have any combination of Project, Project Phase or Project Task worktags for the same line.
Cannot have an Employee Worktag along with a Contingent Worker Worktag for the same line.
Ledger Account or Ledger Account Summary is required.
validation.description: Ledger Account or Ledger Account Summary is required.

validation.validation: The Account type of the Ledger Account or Ledger Account Summary for Business Plan Entry Line selected must be in common with the Account Types selected on the Business Plan Structure.
validation.description: The Account type of the Ledger Account or Ledger Account Summary for Business Plan Entry Line selected must be in common with the Account Types selected on the Business Plan Structure.

validation.validation: Neither Ledger Account nor Ledger Account Summary may be specified since Ledger Account is not a Structured Dimension on the Budget Structure.
validation.description: Neither Ledger Account nor Ledger Account Summary may be specified since Ledger Account is not a Structured Dimension on the Budget Structure.

validation.validation: Book Code cannot be specified since it is not a Structured Dimension on the Plan Structure
validation.description: Book Code cannot be specified since it is not a Structured Dimension on the Plan Structure

validation.validation: Select hours as unit when you select record quantity and a quantity exists.
Clear the quantity and unit of time fields when you don't select record quantity.
You can only enter a company or company hierarchy that's associated with the budget. This company or company hierarchy is invalid: [company or company hierarchy].
Enter a transaction credit or debit amount when you select record quantity.
Enter a quantity when you select record quantity and a unit exists.
Transaction Currency must be defined for Budgets that have multi-currency enabled.
Ledger account [financial_report_group] isn't valid for this company: [company]. Change the ledger account on plan lines for this plan: [plan].
These worktags aren't valid for company [company]: [accounting_worktag]. Change the invalid worktags on this plan: [plan].
Define currency conversion rates between plan currency [budgetCurrency] and the ledger currency [baseCurrency] for company [company] for this start date and plan: [budgetStartDate], [plan].
The book code [book code] isn't valid for this plan structure: [plan structure]. Either change the entered book code for plan [plan], or add it to the plan structure.
Only one worktag of each type is allowed per plan line. These worktag types for plan [plan] have multiple entries: [worktag type].
Credit Amount and Debit Amount can't both have values on the same line. Remove either one on this line for plan: [plan].
This plan structure requires a book code: [plan structure]. Add a book code to this plan: [plan].
This is a single currency plan: [plan]. Enter the company currency for this company or the consolidation details default reporting currency for this company hierarchy: [company or company hierarchy].

The plan period for the year [fiscal year] and fiscal time interval [fiscal time interval] doesn't exist for this plan: [plan]. Change the year and fiscal time interval so they're valid for the target plan period, or change the plan template to include the entered plan period.
The Budget Structure ([Budget Structure]) does not match with the Budget Structure associated with the Budget
Submit budget cannot be used for child budgets. Please use the UI to submit your budget.
You can only maintain active budgets. This budget is inactive: [budget name]
You can only use import budget for plans that are standalone or at a child level. You cannot import for any plans on this virtual parent plan structure: [plan structure].
Enter a Budget Period Reference that matches a period from the configured Budget Name Reference.
You can only use Budget Period Reference for REPLACE_ALL_BY_PERIOD import mode. Either change the import mode or remove the budget period reference.
When Budget Period Reference is configured for REPLACE_ALL_BY_PERIOD import mode, Submit can't equal Y. Leave Submit blank or enter N.
